ExCnt.EX: The teapot stood tall above the rest of the set on the tray shining magnificently .
The sun rose magnificently over one of these slopes , warm hues glistening off the windswept , spiky blue ice .
Set in beautiful landscape , Chepstow castle is magnificently sited high upon a river cliff above the Wye .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: really well, impressively (esp in difficult circumstances)

ExCnt.EX: The subsequent report on the incident showed that the company , its staff and workers responded magnificently in the difficult circumstances .
Most of the mothers work . They wear ` power suits ' , attend ` power lunches ' and cope magnificently.
Life may be stressful but you're handling it magnificently .
It is easy , for example , to say that an advertising campaign failed to increase sales . But it may have succeeded magnificently in preventing sales from falling .
Blenheim Palace , the magnificently grand birthplace of Winston Churchill , with 2000 acres of grounds landscaped by Capability Brown , is 35 miles away .
On the face of it, the most magnificently bonkers political decision in modern times was John Major's calling of the 1997 general election.
And these, though magnificently impressive on the lips of their creators, tend to lose their vitality on those of others.

There was various disparaging comments from the Cave camp at the time about (Neil Young producer) David Briggs mixing and production, but Henry's Dream remains one of the most magnificently varied and powerful sets of songs Mr Cave has ever put down to tape.
